\chapter{project documentation}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:project-documentation}}\label{\detokenize{projectdoc::doc}}

\section{introduction}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:introduction}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The whole idea of this project is to make the best use of the \sphinxhref{https://ouster.com/products/software/gemini}{Ouster Gemini}, A new kind of core spatial intelligence software that accurately detects, classifies, and tracks people, objects, and vehicles.
It is purpose built to address the critical need for highly accurate and dependable data, analytics, and live time tracking in the ITS, security, and crowd analytics industry. Through out this project the valubale
data taken from the Gemini perception is received for furthur processing to make the most out of it that helps in creating more robust and convenient applications.
The project can be said to be divided into to parts first the part which can deals with the \sphinxstyleemphasis{configuration} of the ouster Gemini as a software and second that deals with the \sphinxstyleemphasis{received stream data} which will be the core of the application we want to develop.


\section{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:configuration}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
In this part the given APIs from Ouster are used to set the required settings, as well most of the GUI functions can be made through out scripts.
as GUI seemes to be a more convinient way to alter these settings but through the scripts it may be way to help in creating the required application,
for more explanation about each set of APIs refere to {\hyperref[\detokenize{codedoc:apisection}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{code documentation APIs}}}} where the documentation and how to use information are given.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Lidar\_hub configuration \sphinxhyphen{}{\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_lidar_hub_API::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Lidar Hub}}}}\sphinxhyphen{}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
deals with Sensor Management, Recording, Settings, Registration, Execution, Point Zones, Event Zones, Security, Diagnostics, Static.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{perception configuration \sphinxhyphen{}{\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_perception_API::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{perception}}}}\sphinxhyphen{}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
deals with the required settings for ouster detect software that sets the work flow of the perception as detection of objects and the perception id.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Event Zones \sphinxhyphen{}{\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_event_zone_API::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Event Zones}}}}\sphinxhyphen{}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
deals with zones and the events ocurring in each zone.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Gemini data: \sphinxhyphen{}{\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_data_recording::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Data Recording}}}}\sphinxhyphen{}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
deals with the output data of the gemini software

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{gemini\_login: \sphinxhyphen{}{\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_login::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Login}}}}\sphinxhyphen{}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
creates an authorized session for HTTPS requests, it is shared among the above modules to provide the base \sphinxtitleref{URL} and authentication to send requests.

\end{description}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Not all APIs are implemented some APIs are still under development.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{caution}{Caution:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The implemented APIs must be used with caution and response check is the user responsibility as all implementations returns only status code without error handling.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\section{Recieved stream data}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:recieved-stream-data}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Here as will be refered to as \sphinxtitleref{src} or \sphinxtitleref{source code} is the main starting point for making use of the Ouster detect software data since the Ouster software stack outputs
reliable and filtered data, this data can be furthur furnished to develop a well established application. Relying on TCP servers \sphinxstyleemphasis{data will be streamed}, \sphinxstyleemphasis{saved to a queue} and
from the queue \sphinxstyleemphasis{data will be fetched for processing}. All this will be done concurently using threads.

\sphinxAtStartPar
the available JSON Streams.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
object\_list

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
occupations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
clusters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
diagnostics

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
aggregation\_realtime

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
aggregation\_timeseries

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
refere to \sphinxhref{https://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/connecting\_to\_output/connecting-to-output.html}{user manual}  for more specifications.


\section{Code flow and Execution}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:code-flow-and-execution}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
After the socket connection is established, Three threads are created
\begin{quote}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{put\_to\_queue\_thr:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This thread is responsible for \sphinxstylestrong{READING} data from the SSL socket connection and putting it into \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DATA\_QUEUE}} . It uses the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{put\_object\_to\_queue}} function from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{processing.data\_processing}} module.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{read\_from\_queue\_thr:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This thread is responsible for \sphinxstylestrong{RETRIEVING} data from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DATA\_QUEUE}} and making it available for processing.It uses the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_from\_queue}} function from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{processing.data\_processing}} module.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{process\_thr:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This thread is responsible for \sphinxstylestrong{PROCESSING} the data retrieved from the queue.It uses the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{processing\_from\_queue}} function from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{processing.data\_processing}} module.

\end{description}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This application is an example for the future work it was made to be generic as possible by using the approch of modularity.
in this application the time of collision is calculated following the preceeding steps.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
find the nearest two object to the sensor. (an information retrieved from the object list recieved from the stream)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
find the relative velocity magnitude between the same two objects. (the same time stamp is taken in consideratin to make sure the specific required object is found)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
find the relative position magnitude between the same two objects.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
estimate the time of collision between the objects.

\end{enumerate}
\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
assumptions are made that both objects are heading towards the sensor and the written code is just a test for what may come later.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\section{Data shape}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:data-shape}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data streamed refered to as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object\_list}} from gemini is received in JSON format which may be difficult to make furthur processing, so it was better to reorder the data depending on the timestamp
in a python dictionary with the time stamp as the key and the value will be the object it self. refere below to see what the JSON format looks like.


\subsection{shape of received data from stream}

\sphinxAtStartPar

&
\sphinxAtStartPar
float
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Positive rotation about the z\sphinxhyphen{}axis (right\sphinxhyphen{}hand rule).
\\

\sphinxAtStartPar
dimension
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
dimension
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Length, width, height of the bounding box enclosing all points on the object. Length is the extents along the x\sphinxhyphen{}axis, width the extents along the y\sphinxhyphen{}axis, height along the z\sphinxhyphen{}axis. Axis referenced are the axis of the object with x pointing in the direction of motion, y pointing perpendicular to the left, and z pointing up (right\sphinxhyphen{}hand rule).
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
frame\_count
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
int
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Number of frames an object has been visible for. This number and the creation\_ts number both represent the duration the object has been in the sytem’s field of view.
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
creation\_ts
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
int
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Timestamp when the object was first visible in the system’s field of view. This point in time will be before the object was tracked and classified. This number and frame\_count both represent the duration the object has been in the sytem’s field of view. Units in microseconds since Jan. 1, 1970.
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
update\_ts
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
int
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Timestamp the object was last updated. For objects the system has measured in the current frame, this timestamp will be the same as the timestamp at the root level. For objects the system has not measured in the current frame, this timestamp will stay at the timestamp when the object was last measured and lag behind the timestamp at the root level. An object will be considered measured when the lidars have captured a minimum number of points on the target. Units in microseconds since Jan. 1, 1970.
\\
\sphinxbottomrule

\sphinxAtStartPar
The previous {\hyperref[\detokenize{projectdoc:object-example-ref}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{code snippet}}}} shows the shape of the streamed data followed by its explanation in the tables. the code refines the data streamed and puts it in
a python dictionary form as mentioned above. the global variable \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{TIMESTAMP}} defined in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{processing.data\_processing}} {\hyperref[\detokenize{processing:processing-data-ref}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{module}}}} is the variable that will hold the refined data.
it consists of \sphinxstyleemphasis{key} as the \sphinxstyleemphasis{timestamp} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{dictionary values} where their \sphinxstyleemphasis{key} are the \sphinxstyleemphasis{name of the attribute} and the value \sphinxstyleemphasis{are lists of the data}. refere below for explanation

\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{tip}{Tip:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
every object is known by its obj\_id and to get the related information of that specific obj\_id use indexing.
for example in the above data shape. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{obj\_id}} 11111 will have index 0 then to locate its velocity for example index \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{velocity}} with index 0.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{timestamp}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1701174658528965}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{velocity}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{x}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{11}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{y}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{11}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{z}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{11}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxAtStartPar
this made the data more refined and every time stamp is known what objects are captured within it with each information related to that object.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
for calculations this data is converted to pandas DataFrame for the ease of its calculations. refere to the helper methods at {\hyperref[\detokenize{processing:processing-utils-ref}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{processing.utils module}}}}
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\section{Data integrity}
\label{\detokenize{projectdoc:data-integrity}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To make sure that each object has a unique ID we have to make sure that the sensors installed are all in the same perception.
The ouster detect software stack gives each object a unique ID \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{uuid}} once it is detected in the perception if the object lost from the perception and enters again
the ouster detect will give it a new \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{uuid}} so its our responsibility to make sure that our interested area is fully covered and the sensors area of coverage are well
installed to make sure that if an object never leaves our area of interest. another consideration while receiveing through the stream to make sure that we don’t loose any
data or we get an interrupted message ouster software stack sends a 32\sphinxhyphen{}bit unsigned integer with big endian byte order which represents the total length of the message
by checking on these 4\sphinxhyphen{}bytes we know the size of the expected data to receive. see \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{put\_object\_to\_queue}} method at {\hyperref[\detokenize{processing:processing-data-ref}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{processing.data\_processing module}}}}

\sphinxstepscope

\subsubsection{SSL/TLS Socket Conection}
\label{\detokenize{connection:ssl-tls-socket-conection}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The method \sphinxtitleref{connect\_to\_ssl\_socket} is called to establish an SSL socket connection.
This function atemps to create a secure connection using the TLSv1.2 protocol.
If the connection is successful, an informational message is logged stating that the connection has been establishe

and converts the specified element (distance from sensor) to a dataframe

\sphinxlineitem{Args:}\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{data\_dict}

\section{APIs}
\label{\detokenize{codedoc:apis}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{codedoc:apisection}}
\sphinxstepscope


\subsection{Login}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_login:login}}\label{\detokenize{gemini_login::doc}}

\subsubsection{Description}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_login:description}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The module is used to set up an authorized session for HTTPS request.
The module uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HOST}} located at {\hyperref[\detokenize{connection::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{connection package}}}} which is by \sphinxstylestrong{default} the \sphinxstyleemphasis{local host} as the base \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{URL}} for the connection.
The module as well defines \sphinxstylestrong{the AUTHENTICATION credentials} which may be required to be changed if the user changes them after his/her first login.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{caution}{Caution:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
the default values for user name and password are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{USERNAME}} : ouster

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PASSWORD}} : stone\sphinxhyphen{}pass\sphinxhyphen{}fill

\end{itemize}
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gemini\_login@\spxentry{gemini\_login}}\index{gemini\_login@\spxentry{gemini\_login}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{URL (in module gemini\_login)@\spxentry{URL}\spxextra{in module gemini\_login}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_login:module-gemini_login}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_login:gemini_login.URL}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gemini\_login.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{URL}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\textquotesingle{}https://127.0.1.1/\textquotesingle{}}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
It is the base url used through all the application.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{login\_ouster() (in module gemini\_login)@\spxentry{login\_ouster()}\spxextra{in module gemini\_login}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_login:gemini_login.login_ouster}}
\pysigstartsignatures

\label{\detokenize{gemini_login:id1}}

\subsection{Lidar Hub}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_lidar_hub_API:lidar-hub}}\label{\detokenize{gemini_lidar_hub_API::doc}}

\subsubsection{Description}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_lidar_hub_API:description}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The module is used to set/get the setting of the Lidar Hub .
Lidar Hub works as the interface between the ouster detect software and the user. it integrates other features as well.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
On\sphinxhyphen{}device Aggregation of occupations and object lists

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The gathering and reporting of Diagnostics and Alerts to the Ouster Connect

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Down\sphinxhyphen{}sampling, Batching and Filtering of Perception JSON Streams used by: \sphinxhyphen{} TCP Relay

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Server(s) \sphinxhyphen{} MQTT Publishers

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
On\sphinxhyphen{}device Data Recording of JSON Streams and Point Cloud data

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The module uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{URL}} located at {\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_login::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Login}}}} as the base url.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
for more information on the module and for the information about the fields that can be altered in the
JSON files being sent as request body please refere to the \sphinxhref{https://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/lidar\_hub/lidar\_hub.html\#}{user manual}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gemini\_lidar\_hub\_API@\spxentry{gemini\_lidar\_hub\_API}}\index{gemini\_lidar\_hub\_API@\spxentry{gemini\_lidar\_hub\_API}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_lidar_hub_API:module-gemini_lidar_hub_API}}

\sphinxstepscope


\subsection{perception}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_perception_API:perception}}\label{\detokenize{gemini_perception_API::doc}}

\subsubsection{Description}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_perception_API:description}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The module is used to set/get the setting of the perception.
The module uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{URL}} located at {\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_login::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Login}}}} as the base url.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
for more information on the module and for the information about the fields that can be altered in the
JSON files being sent as request body please refere to the \sphinxhref{https://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/lidar\_hub/lidar\_hub.html\#perception-software-stack}{user manual}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gemini\_perception\_API@\spxentry{gemini\_perception\_API}}\index{gemini\_perception\_API@\spxentry{gemini\_perception\_API}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_perception_API:module-gemini_perception_API}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures

\sphinxstepscope


\subsection{Event Zones}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_event_zone_API:event-zones}}\label{\detokenize{gemini_event_zone_API::doc}}

\subsubsection{Description}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_event_zone_API:description}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The module is used to set/get the setting of event zones and add/delete zones.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The module uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{URL}} located at {\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_login::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Login}}}} as the base url.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
for more information on the module and for the information about the fields that can be altered in the
JSON files being sent as request body please refere to the \sphinxhref{https://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/connecting\_to\_output/connecting-to-output.html}{user manual}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gemini\_event\_zone\_API@\spxentry{gemini\_event\_zone\_API}}\index{gemini\_event\_zone\_API@\spxentry{gemini\_event\_zone\_API}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_event_zone_API:module-gemini_event_zone_API}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\subsection{Data Recording}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_data_recording:data-recording}}\label{\detokenize{gemini_data_recording::doc}}

\subsubsection{Description}
\label{\detokenize{gemini_data_recording:description}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
used to retreive the recorded data from the ouster perception.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The Lidar Hub has an on\sphinxhyphen{}device \sphinxhref{https://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/lidar\_hub/lidar\_hub.html\#json-data-recorder}{JSON Data Recorder} module with timed\sphinxhyphen{}rotation, retention period, compression and purge strategies. Object Lists, Occupations,
Aggregation and Diagnostics will be recorded into a combined file. By default, recordings are saved to /opt/ouster/conf/data/recordings/.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The Lidar Hub includes an on\sphinxhyphen{}device \sphinxhref{https://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/lidar\_hub/lidar\_hub.html\#aggregation-module}{Aggregation module}  that aggregates zone occupations by timeseries by object classification. A system\sphinxhyphen{}defined classification of “ALL” will also be aggregated for each zone representing an aggregate of all objects.
The Aggregation module also aggregates all tracked objects by timeseries by object classification into a system\sphinxhyphen{}defined site\sphinxhyphen{}wide zone with an id of 0

\sphinxAtStartPar
The module uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{URL}} located at {\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_login::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Login}}}} as the base url.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
for more information on the module and for the information about the fields that can be altered in the
JSON files being sent as request body please refere to the \sphinxhref{hhttps://static.ouster.dev/ouster-detect/lidar\_hub/lidar\_hub.html\#json-data-recorder}{user manual}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
refere to the module {\hyperref[\detokenize{gemini_lidar_hub_API::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc}{Lidar Hub}}}} to know how to set the fields to start and define the desired data for recording.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gemini\_data\_recording@\spxentry{gemini\_data\_recording}}\index{gemini\_data\_recording@\spxentry{gemini\_data\_recording}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gemini_data_recording:module-gemini_data_recording}}
